name: Pullman London St Pancras

reviews.text: Firstly, if going here from the airport - try to take public transport. A taxi takes nearly 1.5hrs and is expensive. A chauffeur drive is easier if prebooked and still takes extra time than public transport. Use the regular tube along the picadilly line. When you exit the station on euston road, turn right and the hotel is one block down.
reviews.title: Little things were the let down.

reviews.text: I was booked into an executive room and got a room on the 10th floor with great views of the British library (right next door) and the st pancras station.
reviews.title: Nice staff, great location, good rooms

reviews.text: For the price I paid - I was a little dissapointed with the room. Simple things - the coffee machine was set up on the cabinet and I read the instructions to work it. Nothing worked! Then I looked behind and it wasn't plugged in. Then there was the mission of reaching behind the large cabinet and contort myself to attach the plug. Then the Internet keyboard didn't work - the batteries were corroded. Of course a call to reception fixed this, but as it was 5am that I wanted to use the Internet, this was highly inconvenient.
reviews.title: Food place to stay as well located, but not really 4 stars...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked this hotel for an overnight stay with proximity to the train stations.
reviews.title: Average. Good location but avoid rooms facing street.

reviews.text: Our biggest problem was that service or customer empathy is lacking. The entrance to the hotel has a small number of steps to get up to the front door. We had 2 very heavy suitcases which were difficult to navigate (especially up steps and then struggling to hold open the door). We could see the bellman inside chatting with other employees .. no sign of any assistance to help either open doors or with luggage up the stairs.
reviews.title: Brilliant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ironically, once we were settled, later that day (around 7 pm) we sat in the lobby waiting for friends to join us.. over the course of an hour saw 5-10 other couples also struggle to bring their bags up the stairs without any offer of assistance. I could understand if the bellhop was busy helping other guests, but he seemed to have disappeared for over an hour. Front desk staff didn't seemed bothered one bit.
reviews.title: Better than expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was average. Good amenities but bed was very soft. We stayed at 6 different hotels in the course of our 3 week trip... we're not that picky but this bed really was far too soft. Our room was on the 2nd floor, facing the street. Might have slept a total of an hour due to the ongoing street noise outside. The window was very poorly insulated, which felt as if it was wide open. Recommend either a room facing the other side of the hotel or perhaps one on a higher floor with a tighter seal around the window.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel in a perfect location for travelling around London

reviews.text: Check out didn't even include the courtesy of the usual question "how was everything?".
reviews.title: Ideally located for business meetings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First, let me say that I got an unbelievable $85/night deal by bidding on priceline using bidding techniques widely available online. So I feel badly rating this hotel low since I received far more than what I paid.
reviews.title: Good for business traveler - not for sightseeing

reviews.text: However...
reviews.title: Novotel sucks, this one was fairly typical

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is on the very edge of Bloomsbury, about 15 minute walk of British Museum, and is between two major railway stations. If you are business traveler with frequent train trips from London, it couldn't be better. If you are on vacation - the location is bad. The neighborhood is OK but a bit seedy...no decent restaurants within walking distance, so you're taking a cab everywhere, which eats into the great rate you may have gotten.
reviews.title: Good Location

reviews.text: You're close to to tube stations, but if you are used to walking to your sights, it's very difficult.
reviews.title: Good location, comfortable, and pleasant...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reception desk staff seems like they are new to the area (and country - although all speak English), so asking them for a restaurant recommendations was useless. While concierges at most hotels we've stayed at always had a recommendation or two and offered to make reservations, here we were directed to use the (non-working) touch screen display by one, and "take a cab into the center and go anywhere" by another.
reviews.title: A safe bet for central London

reviews.text: Stayed here for one night and were impressed! The hotel is 2 mins walk from St Pancras station and is one of the best chain hotels we have stayed in for a while. We checked in late and were delighted to be upgraded to an executive room on the top floor. They didn't tell us this at reception we just worked it out! The middle lift has a wonderful view of central London and was well worth the slightly longer wait. Our room was spacious with a lovely big and sleep inducing bed. The room was high enough up to not be overlooked and gave us an amazing view of the northern part of the city. The nespresso machine produced gorgeous coffee and was much appreciated, all in all we were delighted. I rushed off to a work engagement in the morning but my partner who had more time enjoyed a leisurely and ample breakfast as checkout wasn't until 12. The hotel looked after our bags so that my partner able to enjoy a day in London without his suitcase and he picked it up at the end of day on the way back to St Pancras. All in all a very good and convenient hotel we will definitely go back. Thank you!
reviews.title: Great views of London!
Excellent choice!
reviews.text: I was searching for a long time for a good hotel in London, but finally I'm sure I've found it! Comfortable, clean and cosy rooms, great location (close to the tube and railway) and excellent service! Wonderful view from the panoramic lift. Very helpful staff.

This hotel is very handy when arriving on a train at Kings Cross its just a few minutes walk away. We were lucky enought to find that our room was ready even at 12.00pm so that was a bonus. The lift up to the room was glass giving us a view of the city as we travelled upwards!
reviews.title: Great Location
Too much bureaucracy, not enough hospitality
reviews.text: Five days before arrival I received an Accor e-mail puporting to help me, but it was just the usual Accor marketing for Air France and for Europcar, plus marketing for a limousine service from Heathrow and over-priced London 'attractions'. The factual information was pathetic. St Pancras, Kings Cross and Euston stations were rubbed out on the map (yet this is the hotel's USP); St Pancras was given as 10km away at one point; no mention of the Picaddilly line; no mention of the congestion charge. I hope I have now successfully unsubscribed from Accor spam, in accordance with EU data privacy legislation.

At check-in, I was pleased to be offered a form with all my previously-provided details (except I have not provided my passport number). I made to sign, but the clerk asked me to give my passport number. I said that as a UK national, I was not obliged to carry my passport in the UK. He said that as my given address was outside the UK, it was a legal requirement. I said this was a lie, but he would not budge. The fact that I have held a Accor 'loyalty' card for nearly 20 years, and had provided a Bank of Scotland credit card in the usual way was of no interest to this officious employee who seemed only interested in demonstrating his loyalty to his employer. To break the impasse, I had to resort to changing my address to a UK address, and the employee changed my profile accordingly. That meant that at check-out I had to change back to my given address in order to be sure of getting my points (and this was done by a sympathetic clerkess).
reviews.title: Huge rooms, a more modern hotel, with multiple languages at reception

reviews.text: Although I had booked for two nights at the best available rate, I was given a room without one drawer or one shelf, which was a new experience in this hotel. I had to use my case perched on a bedside table. The window was badly fitted, letting in cold night air. I just could not be bothered asking for a room swap. Perhaps this was the clerk's punishment for me taking issue with him.
reviews.title: convenient for train station, decent hotel in a charmless way

reviews.text: Afterwards, I was sent by the hotel yet another pointless Accor questionnaire. From now on, every time Accor ask for my views I shall give them via Trip Advisor (although, as mentioned, I hope to have stopped this Accor spam). I wrote to the MD of Accor UK (I got his name from a previous questionnaire) to complain about the check-in. As an A Club card holder I feel entitled to complain about an Accor employee who behaves objectionably, as I am obliged by the card's terms and conditions to be courteous at all times. After two months I have received no reply.
reviews.title: EXcellent 4 star hotel, well located to transport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is quite modern, and the rooms are hhhuuuggggeee! There is a separate area with a sofa and another television where friends that are waiting for you may sit down.
reviews.title: Worst Hotel Ever Stayed In

reviews.text: I'm not sure we made the right choice. Yes it was close to the station and clean but for 270 euros I would have expected a good night sleep and breakfast
reviews.title: Top location, clean but expensive.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Positive:
reviews.title: Modest Price/Quality ratio - noisy due to regular ambulance sirens

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best and worst things about this hotel are its location. It's very handy for St Pancras and King's Cross, but almost too handy at it fronts the very busy Euston Road. We had a room at the front (the noisiest side) but it didn't bother us too much. The room was reasonably large and the bed very comfortable but we thought the air con was in fact just a fan system. I would recommend this hotel if you need to stay in this area of London. If you don't then find somewhere else.
reviews.title: Location & Location

reviews.text: I stay at this hotel on business but this time it was to spend two days watching cricket at Lords with an old friend. As usual the service was excellent. Good location, very helpful staff, good rooms and always at the same quality level. That's all I want in a hotel.
reviews.title: Always a good place to stay
Good business hotel
reviews.text: This is a good business hotel - centrally located. Some services such as Internet and Breakfast are too expensive though. I'd stay there again as it is very central. Would recommend asking for higher floors

reviews.title: Novotel St Pancras
reviews.text: This hotel was excellent for our needs. Very close to King;s cross station and eurostar terminal. Slight hiccup with check in , but sorted out. Staff very freindly, rooms comfortable. Excellent breakfast.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife had a medical emergency 1 week before our stay that made her unable to fly. The airlines (American) refunded our non-refundable tickets due to the extenuating circumstances. The Novotel London St Pancras refused to help whatsoever, despite the fact that I frequently stayed at their hotel, have a family owned travel agency, and gave them 1 week advance notice to rebook the room.
reviews.title: DO NOT BOOK! Worst management and customer service in the industry

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They have exhibited the worst customer service I have ever experienced, and I will not book this hotel or the Novotel chain again for any of my clients or my family.
reviews.title: Very Good - will stay there again
Corporate and indifferent with a smidgeon of humour
reviews.text: Very pleased with the hotel... modern and new. Room was spacious, clean and modern. We stay on a bed and breakfast basis and the breakfast was a buffet with good quality food.

I pass the Novotel St Pancras everyday on my way to work, so it seemed amusing to stay overnight prior to taking the Eurostar train to Avignon early on a Saturday. We booked an executive room complete with breakfast for £145, which, according to the receptionist, who couldn't/wouldn't accommodate our request for an early-morning breakfast, is a virtually unheard of rate that happens only twice a year when the moon is in ascendance of Uranus, the usual being an eye-watering £305. Perhaps that's par for the course for a room on the 16th floor in this neck of the woods, and it was certainly an impressive ride up in the panoramic lift. Sadly, when we arrived at said room, we discovered a room and bathroom really only big enough for one (i.e., designed for the executive a seul rather than touristes a deux), a wastebin still full of the previous occupant's rubbish, a half-full 'complementary' bottle of water, and air-con that moved air but did nothing to condition it. Some phone calls later, we got moved to a different room on the same floor where everything was more of less as advertised.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel

reviews.text: The 'complementary' internet access, however, turned out to be restricted to the keyboard attached to the TV; using your own laptop and wifi meant a 10 euro charge, which irked somewhat. We tried the food in the groundfloor, "award-winning" restaurant, 'Mirrors'. As hotel restaurants go, this wasn't bad, meaning that some dishes worked and some didn't, but the unintentional highlight was the serving of my dessert, which started off with the wrong dessert and then the replacement doing a spectacular summersault on the serving plate, a feat impossible to repeat even if you tried. At checkout, the guy behind the desk asked us whether we'd enjoyed our stay, but I don't think he really cared, as he was walking away from us as we reeled off the problems with the room. So, that's the Novotel Euston for you: a well-situated hotel with an impressive view, but very corporate and with rather indifferent service.
reviews.title: A place to stay only if your employer is paying

aka: Novotel London St Pancras Hotel London
description: Following a £10million transformation the hotel this 4-star upscale hotel is perfectly located for business or leisure. Only 3 minutes' walk from the International Eurostar terminal and 5 minutes' walk from Kings Cross or Euston Underground and train stations. Pullman London St Pancras is well placed in Central London, adjacent to the British Library. The British Museum, Covent Garden, Oxford Street, West End and The City are only 10 minutes away by Tube. The hotel is also only 7 minutes away from Stratford's Olympic Park by Javelin train. Pullman St Pancras boasts the Golden Arrow restaurant and bar, as well as complimentary (standard) Wi-Fi internet access, a fitness centre, 17 meeting rooms and 24-hour room service.
